text:
Sure,  at the time I stayed for 2 nights,  this is still considered to be a new hotel but it felt like a very poorly managed and designed hotel.

The Entrance:
- Steep stairways into lobby ensured that this was not a friendly hotel for older people
- The drop-off area is too narrow so when a car stops the entire place starts forming a queue

The Lobby:
- Very distinct odour of trash upon entrance.  The frontdesk staff greeted me as if no such odour exists.  LoL
- Trash was being taken between floors by using the Guest's lift leaving a permanent odour inside the lift that lingered on during the 2 nights stay

The Room (524):
- Hard Bed
- Towels had yellow stains and was torn. Not representative of a new hotel
- tv and phone was not working.  It relied on wifi and so I had to go down to report all those issue
-  Safety box was useless as it was left locked by previous occupants. The engineer/technician had no clue how to bypass the lock and simply responded that it would require the reseller to fix it and without providing information on how and when it would be done. 
- very poorly insulated from noise. You could hear the sound from the cafe from the hotel next door.
- very noisy hallway outside of room. They used open-ended design to allow proper airflow at the sacrifice of every noise pouring into the room. It was like having NO DOORS in the room and made for a VERY POOR SLEEPING EXPERIENCE
title: Not The Place to Rest
